headline: Boeing's Order Book Soars On Korean Air Mega-Deal And Hopes For China Sales
summary: On Tuesday, Boeing Co. (NYSE:BA) secured a $36.2 billion deal with Korean Air for 103 planes, including a mix of 787, 777, and 737 passenger jets. Boeing’s commercial planes chief, Stephanie Pope, hailed the deal as a “landmark agreement.” The deal covers 50 Boeing 737-10 passenger aircraft and 45 long-range jets, along with eight 777-8 Freighter cargo planes for Korean Air. This deal is expected to support around 135,000 jobs across the U.S. Boeing is nearing a deal to secure a substantial airc

headline: Cohort V graduates from the Boeing | TMCF Scholar Program
summary: Washington, D.C., Aug. 28, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Seven Thurgood Marshall College Fund (TMCF) scholars recently graduated from the Boeing | TMCF Scholar Program at a ceremony held in St. Louis. The program provides an exceptional career opportunity and scholarship for outstanding students attending historically Black colleges and universities (HBCUs), in partnership with TMCF and The Boeing Company. headline: BAE Systems rolls out newest combat vehicle for the Czech Army
summary: The rollout ceremony, hosted by Swedish Minister of Defence Pål Jonson welcomed Czech Minister of Defence Jana Černochová and marked a significant step in strengthening the Czech Republic's defence capabilities and fulfilling its commitments to NATO.

headline: Is Boeing Offering Value After 4% Rally and Strong Recovery Expectations in 2025?
summary: If you are looking at Boeing's recent stock chart and wondering whether now is the time to buy, sell, or simply hold steady, you are not alone. This is a stock that never fades from the spotlight. Boeing is a titan of the aerospace world, influenced by global trends, innovation, and, lately, shifts in investor risk appetite. headline: Boeing seeks EU approval for Spirit deal
summary: Boeing is seeking EU approval to buy back Spirit AeroSystems, the world's largest standalone aerostructures company, documents on the European Commission website show. Boeing said in July last year that it had agreed to buy its former subsidiary for $4.7 billion in shares while Airbus would take on the supplier's loss-making Europe-focused activities. The EU executive body is expected to make its decision on the deal by September 30.
